awd_titl_txt: P-POD Auxiliary Payload on the STP-ST26/Minotaur-IV Launch
awd_abstract_narration: This is a transfer of funds to the U.S. Air Force Space Test Program for accommodations and launch services for an auxiliary payload carrying a NSF-sponsored spacecraft on the STP-S26/Minotaur-IV launch scheduled for December 2009.  The NSF sponsored nano-satellite will be a "triple (3U) cubesat" and will utilize the Poly-Picosat Orbital Deployer (P-POD) system.   The purpose of the NSF nano-satellite mission will be space weather research.  The selection of the mission will be done following a solicitation for proposals and scientific and technical review of the proposals.  This will be the first project under a new NSF initiative titled: "CubeSat-based Science Missions for Space Weather and Atmospheric Research."
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences

inst.inst_name: Department of the Air Force, Space and Missile Systems Center
